snippet: Billions of dollars in Liberty bonds, insurance money, developer fees: Year after year, Larry A. Silverstein has shaken the public tree and benefits have fallen to the ground.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column; developer and philanthropist Larry A Silverstein has internalized a developer’s rule of thumb in New York--only a rube puts much of his own money at risk; year after year, he has shaken the public tree and benefits have fallen to the ground; now he has asked the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to guarantee up to $1.2 billion of his construction loans on 3 World Trade Center.
